org.spongepowered.api.util.command.args

Class GenericArguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.util.command.args.GenericArguments

  • public final class GenericArguments
extends Object
    Class containing factory methods for common command elements.

        public static CommandElement playerOrSource(Text key,
                                            Game game)
        Expect an argument to represent an online player, or if nothing matches and the source is a Player, give the player. Gives value of type Player
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        game - The game to find players in
        Returns:
        the argument

        public static CommandElement world(Text key,
                                   Game game)

        Parameters:

        game - The game to find worlds from

      • seq

        Consumes a series of arguments. Usage is the elements concated
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Map<String,?> choices)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values. If there are 5 or fewer choices available, the choices will be shown in the command usage. Otherwise, the usage will only display only the key. To override this behavior, see choices(Text, Map, boolean).
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Map<String,?> choices,
                                     boolean choicesInUsage)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values. Unless choicesInUsage is true, general command usage will only display the provided key
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        choicesInUsage - Whether to display the available choices, or simply the provided key, as part of usage
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • firstParsing

        public static CommandElement firstParsing(CommandElement... elements)
        Returns a command element that matches the first of the provided elements that parses. Tab completion matches from all options
        Parameters:
        elements - The elements to check against
        Returns:
        The command element matching the first passing of the elements provided

      • optional

        public static CommandElement optional(CommandElement element)
        Make the provided command element optional This means the command element is not required. However, if the element is provided with invalid format and there are no more args specified, any errors will still be passed on.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optional

        public static CommandElement optional(CommandElement element,
                                      Object value)
        Make the provided command element optional This means the command element is not required. However, if the element is provided with invalid format and there are no more args specified, any errors will still be passed on. If the given element's key and value are not null and this element is not provided the element's key will be set to the given value.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        value - The default value to set
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optionalWeak

        public static CommandElement optionalWeak(CommandElement element)
        Make the provided command element optional This means the command element is not required. If the argument is provided but of invalid format, it will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optionalWeak

        public static CommandElement optionalWeak(CommandElement element,
                                          Object value)
        Make the provided command element optional This means the command element is not required. If the argument is provided but of invalid format, it will be skipped. If the given element's key and value are not null and this element is not provided the element's key will be set to the given value.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        value - The default value to set
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • repeated

        public static CommandElement repeated(CommandElement element,
                                      int times)
        Require a given command element to be provided a certain number of times Command values will be stored under their provided keys in the CommandContext
        Parameters:
        element - The element to repeat
        times - The number of times to repeat the element.
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • allOf

        public static CommandElement allOf(CommandElement element)
        Require all remaining args to match as many instances of CommandElement as will fit Command element values will be stored under their provided keys in the CommandContext.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to repeat
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • string

        public static CommandElement string(Text key)
        Require an argument to be a string. Any provided argument will fit in under this argument. Gives values of type String.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • integer

        public static CommandElement integer(Text key)
        Require an argument to be an integer (base 10). Gives values of type Integer
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • bool

        public static CommandElement bool(Text key)
        Require an argument to be a boolean. The recognized true values are:
        • true
        • t
        • yes
        • y
        • verymuchso
        The recognized false values are:
        • false
        • f
        • no
        • n
        • notatall
        Gives values of type Boolean
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • enumValue

        public static <T extends Enum<T>> CommandElement enumValue(Text key,
                                                           Class<T> type)
        Require the argument to be a key under the provided enum. Gives values of type T
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of enum
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the matched enum value under
        type - The enum class to get enum constants from
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • remainingJoinedStrings

        public static CommandElement remainingJoinedStrings(Text key)
        Require one or more strings, which are combined into a single, space-separated string. Gives values of type String
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • literal

        public static CommandElement literal(Text key,
                                     String... expectedArgs)
        Expect a literal sequence of arguments. This element matches the input against a predefined array of arguments expected to be present, case-insensitively.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to add to the context. Will be set to a value of true if this element matches
        expectedArgs - The sequence of arguments expected
        Returns:
        the appropriate command element

      • literal

        public static CommandElement literal(Text key,
                                     @Nullable
                                     Object putValue,
                                     String... expectedArgs)
        Expect a literal sequence of arguments. This element matches the input against a predefined array of arguments expected to be present, case-insensitively.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store this argument as
        putValue - The value to put at key if this argument matches. May be null
        expectedArgs - The sequence of arguments expected
        Returns:
        the appropriate command element

      • onlyOne

        public static CommandElement onlyOne(CommandElement element)
        Restricts the given command element to only insert one value into the context at the provided key.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to restrict
        Returns:
        the restricted element
